website_summaries.verdict: A steel can will cost you a little more, but will make up for cost in reliability.
pros: Includes a screen to help stop flames if the gas can catches fire
Funnel snaps to the can to keep it handy
Spring loaded handle helps open the cap
2-gallon capacity prevents this can from getting too heavy
cons: The funnel is not as practical as the rest of the can and can be cumbersome

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the price and that’s really just because I’m a cheapskate. However, that being said, I’m a firm believer in the right tool for the right job and this fits the bill. Under long-term professional use, I have witnessed the yellow plastic funnel crack at the base where it attaches by friction to the can, but that was being abused daily by arborists and landscape crews. If it can survive that, this product will serve a homeowner a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Mathieu Perry

customer_reviews.title: User Unfriendly
customer_reviews.text: Eagle gas cans were my favorite in the past. The present design may be very safe for storing gas, but very user unfriendly. I now own 3 types of gas cans of currently-acceptable deign and this is the worst. It is most useful to me without the supplied funnel. To fill my generator tank I use a conventional funnel. The supplied funnel is somewhat convenient after I cut 1/2" off the funnel neck that contacts the can. The product tolerancing is poor. Try before you buy because the item is non-returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Can, good.  Funnel, not so good
customer_reviews.text: Does this can remind anybody else of Spy vs Spy? The can itself and the spring-loaded lid are solid, no complaints. Definitely better than the red-plastic CARB cans. The funnel, however... It's a bit awkward to remove the funnel, and you have to remove it to fill the can. Also, if you leave the can outdoors, the funnel collects dust and dirt that you really don't want to wash down into your equipment. I might try using it without the funnel, or with a separate funnel.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in 2011. Still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever tried to use one of those plastic gas cans with the spring-loaded spout that looks like it was dreamed up by some idiot legislator in California, you know the frustration. The thing that is supposed to prevent spills does nothing but cause a ridiculous amount of gas to be spilled all over your mower, driveway and hands. This gas can solves the problem once and for all. I love it. And of course, the fact that it's not available in California is the cherry on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Deckard

customer_reviews.title: Well built heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple 5 gallon cans similar to this. I needed a smaller one for gas/oil mix. The heavy gauge steel will hold up to most abuse. The spring on the spout is solid and strong and will not leak, seals tight and doesn't leak or off gas if the contents expand. The funnel is the only real issue. It's a bit awkward to use but so much better than the plastic cans that have complicated spouts.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect but....
customer_reviews.text: I took off one star because while you can store and dispense from the can with the funnel in place, you do have to remove the funnel to fill the can. I don't know what the design solution would be to fix that, but I anticipate the plastic funnel attachment ring will break and be the Achilles Heel in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mierzejwski

customer_reviews.title: It leaked in our trunk.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a road trip through the Wild West, where gas stations were far and few between. Works fine, but with the pressure change with going up and down mountains passes, it leaked gasoline in our trunk. What a hassle. Think plastic might work better, as it can expand and contract a bit, while still retaining a seal. Thought the classic metal would be best, but I was wrong. Car smelled like gas for a few days. At least it evaporates.
customer_reviews.author: CHRI

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and do not leak.
customer_reviews.text: These cans are great, they keep out dirt and dust from the fuel, and allow for easy dispensing with the attached funnel. These are OSHA compliant, which is great for on a construction site. No fuel spill out if these tip over, this is super handy when the cans are bouncing around in the back of a pickup. Funel seems to be sturdy. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best cans money can buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2 gallon and 5 gallon Eagle gas cans for personal use at my home after using them at work for years on end. To buy a new can without a crazy plastic junk nozzle is impossible nowadays, these cans a durable and extremely easy to use. They seem expensive compared to other plastic cans but if you buy and use them you will see where that extra money went. Totally worth the money, solid product from a good company.
customer_reviews.author: You don't speak Wookie?

customer_reviews.title: American Made Quality!
customer_reviews.text: American Made Quality, strong, sturdy, I wasn’t sure about the funnel, but after using it, it’s great! I’m really glad I spent the extra money to get this fuel can. Not disappointed at all. Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.author: Roady

customer_reviews.title: Far better than other EPA compliant cans
customer_reviews.text: Most EPA compliant designs I've used cause more leakage than they prevent. This can, though a bit more expensive, is actually easy to use. Most importantly, it's easy to control the flow of gas.
customer_reviews.author: JRL

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Eagle safety cans are great. Only gas can I have used that doesn’t spill all over the vehicle while driving back from the gas station. All my plastic cans either spill or get all bloated in transport. This is a good size for small engines like weed eater or push mower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully constructed secure gas can
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully constructed secure gas can. I can't believe I'm leaving a review about a gas can, but this one is exceptional. No leaks, gas smell. Easy to see when it is full as you are filling the can at the gas station. Don't try placing the funnel into the gas tank of mower, etc. and then opening the cap! Open cap, then pour.Don't "lean" on the funnel as you are pouring, as it might come loose from the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: For Ana

customer_reviews.title: Great gas can , will never purchase anothe plastic one
customer_reviews.text: Great can very durable, funnel can be a bit hard to install and remove overall very pleased, have two five gallon and a one gallon as well this 3 gallon is great for on the road for my generator.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but the handle is awkward
customer_reviews.text: The pull handle that has to be opened to allow you to fill the tank and to empty it into the funnel is plastic and is not designed well. The spring force necessary to open it and keep it open is excessive - particularly when you have to use one hand to keep it open while using your other hand to either use the gasoline dispenser (filling) or to keep the tank steady (emptying). It does seal tight (no gasoline fumes) and the funnel does a really good job of minimizing spills when emptying the tank into the lawnmower fuel tank.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Go Steel!
customer_reviews.text: awesome - going to buy another. Perfect for weedwacker/leaf blower oil/gas mixes. I accidentally bought the 5gal one too for the lawn mower! Probably too big - but I have a fast growing variety of grass that gets mowed every 3 days, so it might actually be a good thing. Well built and better than any plastic models
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Steel kicks plastic’s ass.
customer_reviews.text: These steel gas tanks are bar none beat. They don’t expand or suck in for heat and cold. They last several decades and are safer around hot surfaces. Don’t be a millennial!! Buy steel.
customer_reviews.author: Crimson Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, Second Size and I Love Them
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant, simply brilliant. Wish I bought this before I replaced my cheap big-box-store plastic gas can twice and finally gave up. The design is amazing, cannot tip over, even in the trunk of my car without no tie-down, the top seals and cannot spill, the funnel prevents spilling and overflow when filling. Seriously, just a brilliant gas can that's well thought out. It will last me 25 years+ and is worth the cost of 10 crappy plastic ones you can buy elsewhere (that I would likely purchase over those 25+ years.)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Umbel

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: Since the safety spouts came out, I shopped around for a gas can that was easy to use without making a mess when I filled the lawn mower. This one does just that and it will last me a life time. The only down side is that you have to take the funnel off to fill it, which is not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: seals tight
customer_reviews.text: make sure to release any pressure before fueling or gas will spray everywhere, especially around a hot chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the plastic cans.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these cans for years when I used to work in landscaping. Now I trust them at home. Very simple to use and store gas in without the frustrating pour tubes and screw on tops. I'll be a customer forever.
customer_reviews.author: Ksquared

customer_reviews.title: Heck yes.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how we struggled through using those terrible plastic safety cans before getting this. What a hassle! This thing is amazing and will probably for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Sam H.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and durable
customer_reviews.text: Gas can will leak if at a steep enough angle. Getting the spout on and off has a short but steep learning curve. Miles better than the gas cans with the over engineered spout that breaks in the first year.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy & Sheri Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Steel gas can
customer_reviews.text: It’s steel. No plastic safety’s like most of them today. Quality, and easy to pour
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Its better than the reveiws say.
customer_reviews.text: Best gas can I have bought since 1970. Tip... I use a J hook made from a coathanger to hook on the handle and lever for easy filling... it works great.
customer_reviews.author: martin b. smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy gas can with detachable funnel to fill small motors with
customer_reviews.text: Quality constructed product, will go to my son when I'm gone...
customer_reviews.author: Arthur P

customer_reviews.title: Sturdily constructed, but the funnel is lacking.
customer_reviews.text: The container itself is very well constructed. However, it appears that it cannot be refilled without removing the funnel attachment. This may sound like small potatoes, but it is not as easy as it may sound to install and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick K.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than those plastic safety cans
customer_reviews.text: I could never get those plastic safety cans to work well. Gasoline would go everywhere except in the gas tank... This metal can is a little more expensive, but the design is simple and it works well -- seems like it should last forever. To fill it, you pull the top lever/handle and remove the plastic funnel. The only issue is that the paint is chipping a little on the bottom, and that's the reason for the 4 star rating. I don't think this is a big deal and should deter anyone from buying it, but just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Shady Neighbor

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA quality
customer_reviews.text: A simple, well constructed product made in the USA. No China crap. What more is there to say?
customer_reviews.author: johnboy

customer_reviews.title: Gasoline Alley
customer_reviews.text: Buying items locally is a major reason to purchase from Amazon.com as everyone knows! That said, when you can save on a quality item and cost its' easier on the pocketbook. I tried to purchase a good quality gas can such as this at NAPA Auto Parts and it was priced at $78. Buying a plastic gas can always causes spills because of design and cheap parts. So buying this item at Amazon saved on the original price and no shipping is always a plus. No frills--no spills, I'm Happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger J. Buggle

customer_reviews.title: Great style gas cans
customer_reviews.text: Great size to keep some mixed fuel around. I did have mixed in a 5gal, but that was too much. THese cans are great, just remember to release the pressure before you tilt them to pour out fuel - less mess that way. If used properly, these will fill your machines with no spilling and no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: tay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gas cans and have replaced all of my plastic cans with them. What I like best is the pour spout which is a 200% improvement over any of the current EPA-approved pouring spouts, which seem to take forever to discharge gas. Get one of these cans and the excellent yellow pouring spout and you'll wonder why you didn't do this years ago and you'll definitely never go back to plastic again.
customer_reviews.author: 04rk88

customer_reviews.title: Good can. Meh funnel.
customer_reviews.text: I have no doubt the can last decades. The plastic funnel probably not. Also with they would make the funnel with that hole in it for refueling like that other guy made.
customer_reviews.author: sampson

customer_reviews.title: Great gas can. Should have bought one first thing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend because he liked mine so much. I originally bought mine after buying a half dozen plastic versions only to have them crack or have mice chew holes in them. If I had just bought one of these at the beginning I would have saved myself some money.
customer_reviews.author: PMcG

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I think the big yellow pour thingy is unwieldy. There must be a better way
customer_reviews.author: V. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Metal fuel container
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy fuel can. Removable funnel is a plus. Easy to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Bill76-69

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This can has a good seal, and is a pleasure to take in your car to the gas station, w/o smelling fuel vapors, or spills. Just make sure you press the funnel down, so that it gets a good seal with the can, and pull the lever back slightly (with the can flat) to relieve pressure prior to dispensing fuel; otherwise fuel squirts all over the place. Much better than plastic containers. Also, got the one gallon can for 2 cycle mixture.
customer_reviews.author: Goldrush

customer_reviews.title: Best way to store gas at home.
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. Steel construction, spring loaded closure and anti=flame screen makes this an OSHA compliant gas can. If you store gas in your garage this is the best container to use. It is pricier than the plastic big box store containers, but it is solid, the flat and wide bottom means it won't tip in the back of your truck or car.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Safety can that leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. First of all the plastic handle is not shown in the description. Not that big of a deal. A safety can that leaks!!! As soon as I find something to transfer the fuel into, I'll be returning this item or requesting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Pope

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: so aggravated with plastic gas cans is why I purchased and I wish I had purchased years ago. Will keep gas fresh over the winter. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Millergirl

customer_reviews.title: Good tank, decent price.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, girlfriend hates it. She mows my lawn for me. I fill the tank on the mower. Good trade, I think. This tank will likely last much longer than the plastic one I had that started to split apart at the seam at the handle. Well cared for, it might get handed down to the grandkids...
customer_reviews.author: MrJBRD

customer_reviews.title: Eagle cans are the only way to go
customer_reviews.text: Eagle gas cans - whether you're looking at the 2 or 5 gallon version are the only way to go. The funnel stays attached (although it can be removed to refill) for easy fueling of any equipment. They are easily cleaned and the large metal and plastic handles give you a great surface to hold onto while fueling. Invest in an Eagle gas can. It will be the last gas can you ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: ff344ymfc

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very great gas can and very durable. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog_Fan

customer_reviews.title: Works well and no cap to lose
customer_reviews.text: It works like I wanted. I have not had any problems filling it or using to fill mainly power tools like trimmers and chain saws. Since it is round, I have a little more problem packing in to my truck load of tools when doing volunteer work.
customer_reviews.author: John G. Shuck

customer_reviews.title: Take your chance with an EPA compliant gas can or get one like this that works and won't spill.
customer_reviews.text: Bought EPA compliant gas cans from different vendors. The spout valves on both of them failed. In addition, they are so cumbersome to use that I ended up taking off the spout and pouring into a funnel, defeating the purpose. So I started looking online and found the Eagle gas cans. The spout is a bit weird but it sits in place and does not leak... so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: SCR

customer_reviews.title: Worth the added expense.
customer_reviews.text: I have been yearning for a quality replacement for the ubiquitous plastic gas can and decided to give this a try. So far, so good. One issue that I have had is the relative difficulty of filling this gas can--the spring handle is hard to hold open with one hand while pumping with the other hand. One reviewer suggested using an electrical "zip tie" to hold the handle in the open position while filling, I tend to use a scrap piece of wire or string to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ertz

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great. Paint finish is low quality.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: metal construction, old school. Probably safer than plastic. Strong. Cons: paint coverage is incomplete..there are small points all around the bottom that are not covered at all,perhaps where the container was held while the paint dried. The paint doesn't seem like what I think of as powder coat. It seems cheap, thin and prone to flaking off.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice can
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need, and not flimsy like the overpriced plastic models.
customer_reviews.author: J. Whiddon

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent combination
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Eagle gas cans over the years. I have the 5 gallon and the 2 gallon cans both with the detachable funnels. They work excellent. There is no leakage, dripping or fumes with these cans. The spring loaded sealer cap works perfect and you are able to meter the gasoline out so there is no spillage or mess. Highly recommeded
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jones

customer_reviews.title: Like this can...
customer_reviews.text: my only complaint is that it leaks around the collar when pouring. I probably have not gotten the funnel seated well enough but I did try. Still it is SO much easier to use that that awful 'child proof' plastic one I replaced...which had to twist and push the spout to release the gas while tipping and pouring...awful!
customer_reviews.author: DocDVM

customer_reviews.title: Can arrived dented
customer_reviews.text: Can looks durable and sturdy except for the dent that it arrived with! Hopefully that’s not an indicator of how it will perform in the long run. Hopefully it doesn’t leak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its amazing, a gas can that doesn't spray gas everywhere ...
customer_reviews.text: Its amazing, a gas can that doesn't spray gas everywhere (don't you just love the Obamalations and government control?) If you want to make gas cans great again, this is it! Plus its made in America!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gasser

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars because of price
customer_reviews.text: Wow, a sturdy useful old school product - the price is exorbitant but when you consider that the plastic counterparts only last a few months then leak, warp, or just plain melt then its worth it, 4 stars because of the price
customer_reviews.author: Bluelake

customer_reviews.title: Made in the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.text: Made in the U.S.A. Excellent quality. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LewTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a metal gas can, skip it, because it isn't all metal!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The one I received was not all metal. The pull handle was plastic and yellow, would have never ordered had I known this.
customer_reviews.author: Legal Guy

customer_reviews.title: Old-school quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of money for a gas can. I'm 62 and I've had a lot of junky plastic ones. This one will still be going long after I'm gone. Love everything about it. Old school value. Buy it, enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Plume

customer_reviews.title: strong sturdy..
customer_reviews.text: strong sturdy... find it difficult to handle trying to pour gas in yard equipment...spill much gas....really dont like this new style much....
customer_reviews.author: jackiecampbell

customer_reviews.title: Robust
customer_reviews.text: We use these in construction. I’ve seen them run over with backhoes and still not leak.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid can, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review on their 5 gallon can (of which I have two now), that says similarly, this is the only gas can on the market that leaves you with any sanity after using it. Other brands/models made of plastic are just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tqwrench

customer_reviews.title: Holly gas cans Batman
customer_reviews.text: So much ch better than the cheap plastic c$@p cans you usually see. Take reasonable care of this and you will never have to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: can and lid are great, funnel not so much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gas can to use with my jeep on backcountry trips. The can is great, with a lid that doesn't leak and does allow venting. The funnel, however, does not allow me to pour gas into the jeep without spilling all over the side of the vehicle. I use a longer separate funnel now, and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Beware These Are Factory Seconds
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 of the 2 Gallon size. ALL 3 were dented badly.
customer_reviews.author: Fishtronics

customer_reviews.title: I tried to pour from the can using my own ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to pour from the can using my own funnel but it wouldn't work as it splashed everywhere. The yellow funnel that came with it is awkward to remove and put back on when the can is filled. If the funnel breaks , your out of luck!
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Walker

customer_reviews.title: A little cumbersome to insert the yellow funnel,
customer_reviews.text: A little cumbersome to insert the yellow funnel, but the cap keeps air out of the gasoline which should keep the gasoline all winter or summer long
customer_reviews.author: Number Six

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: Very well made gas can. Doesn't turn over in the back of the truck, solid, and the funnel being included is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: John Fischer

customer_reviews.title: This is the gas can to have.
customer_reviews.text: I switched to the safety can when I visited the local fire department with scouts. The firemen stressed the dangers of the plastic gas cans and the benefits of the safety can. It is more difficult to fill due to the self closing lid, but a minor hassle for peace of mind. I am so impressed with the safety can I bought cans for my parents and children
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and spend the extra few dollars for these. You won't be disappointed. They don't drip at all, are very safe and simple to use. They look great and are extremely durable. They will last 30 years if you keep take basic care of them.
customer_reviews.author: benji

customer_reviews.title: Built to last!
customer_reviews.text: The product is high quality and far surpasses the "plastic cans" typically available in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I love this gas can
customer_reviews.text: I love this gas can. Great quality. I ordered two of these, different sizes. I would recommend this product to a friend. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tony64

customer_reviews.title: No gas in my face
customer_reviews.text: New gas cans suck. I’ve had them crumple and blow up in my face. This can is great. I feel safer with it.
customer_reviews.author: CLS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great gas can I just wish it had a separate ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gas can I just wish it had a separate fill hole It is a little bit of a pain to fill the can through the pouring spout. The pouring funnel does have to removed to fill the can as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Can is brand new, boxed well and projected shipping time was accurate. Happy with purchase and would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gilmer

customer_reviews.title: I wish all gas cans were this sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed. Between the welded steel construction, the galvanizing, and the power coat paint, I don't imagine that these gas cans will rust away in the next couple of decades. They are a HUGE step up from the standard plastic gas cans that will never sit right, will never seal right, and will rarely pour right! We have tried a dozen other gas cans, and these are the only ones that we really trust. If I had bought these in the first place (30 years ago and more recently), I would have probably saved money over the long haul. Don't be put off by the price - they are good for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Stalwart

customer_reviews.title: Gas can
customer_reviews.text: I loved the gas can but dis not like going all over town to pick it up. suppose to be delivered to my house not where you selected the place for me to pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a plastic container, which sprang a leak in my car after filling it at a gas station. Although I would have liked a one gallon container, I just fill it with less fuel - I only use it with my lawn mower. If it hadn't been for the plastic funnel, I would have rated this a 5. Nonetheless, you can't go wrong with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: awesome gas can
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand the 'environmentally friendly' plastic cans that are in the home improvement stores with the plastic spill proof spouts. My opinion is they create spills. This can never rolls over in the car and the funnel style spout pours consistently. The lever action opener works perfectly to stop the flow when you want it to. I have the 5 gallon and the 2 gallon (for mixed gas).
customer_reviews.author: ranger11

customer_reviews.title: Works SO much better than those Chinese plastic cans
customer_reviews.text: Works SO much better than those Chinese plastic cans. Yes its more expensive but they pour gas properly without it spraying, spilling or flipping that old plastic spout our and making a mess of things. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Davis

customer_reviews.title: Safety in a can !
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son after purchasing a 5 gal for myself a while back. These are made well and gives you piece of mind when leaving this in the garage. Plastic funnel a little hard to get off at first but you have look at it and think of how to get it off. Use your brain.
customer_reviews.author: LaHammer

customer_reviews.title: great gas can
customer_reviews.text: this is a high quality gas can. perfect for mixed gas
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: It's the best gas can
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite gas can. As far as gas cans go, this can is the best one. If you want to pour some gas, get this can.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Howard

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price considering the durability as compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price considering the durability as compared to those plastic containers and in terms of safety can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: BillT

customer_reviews.title: Good Can
customer_reviews.text: The can is fine. Heavy duty with a spring loaded cap that closes completely keeping fumes from escaping. The funnel used to pour leaves something to be desired. It leaks around the mouth so you have to be careful when pouring gas.
customer_reviews.author: Indy

customer_reviews.title: I bought this metal can thinking it to be superior to the leaky plastic one designed by the EPA
customer_reviews.text: I bought this metal can thinking it to be superior to the leaky plastic one designed by the EPA. However, this metal one drips on my driveway too when I try filling my lawn mower. I DO have the plastic funnel attached according to directions but the product is no better than the EPA plastic can. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Pat H

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bunnies out
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Seals well, no leaks or spills, but most of all it won’t get chewed through like the last two.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Hinkel

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open.
customer_reviews.text: We thought this would be great, but cap has extremely strong springs that are difficult to open and to manage. Maybe a strong young person could handle it for not for us seniors!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Camenga

customer_reviews.title: we had looked around at several stores and this was by far the best deal. We also have the five gallon Eagle ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Old fashioned husband wanting metal gas can, we had looked around at several stores and this was by far the best deal. We also have the five gallon Eagle gas can and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for filling gas-run tools
customer_reviews.text: Handy gas can for using to fill snowblowers!!! It took two of us to get the nozzle off, and back on again, but only because you need two sets of hands. It wasn't hard to do, just needed those extra hands.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Good gas can.
customer_reviews.text: Great can, only gave it 4 stars because you have to take the funnel off to fill it up, also you have to watch for dirt to accumulate in the funnel.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Eagle 2 gal. Metal Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my eagle gas can. It really is VERY accurate when filling my lawn products. The only thing I wasn't totally happy with is the fact that the funnel has to be removed each time you fill the can with fuel. But...I'll live with it because of the easiness and accuracy of filling my lawn products. Also...Amazon has always been fantastic for their reliability of getting your orders to you and with tracking to boot!
customer_reviews.author: Sprinky183

customer_reviews.title: This is the safety can that I wanted to fill ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the safety can that I wanted to fill my snowblower, tractor, lawnmower and generator. It works well and has the screen built into the pour spout to prevent an explosion.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Ginty

customer_reviews.title: Nice and small
customer_reviews.text: Nice and small. Fits into a small compartment and you don't have to worry about vapors coming out. Great Deal.

customer_reviews.title: Eagle UI-20-FS Red Galvanized Steel Type 1 Gasoline Safety Can with Funnel
customer_reviews.text: Eagle UI-20-FS Red Galvanized Steel Type 1 Gasoline Safety Can with Funnel,... Eagle gas cans are the best by far second to none. I have 7 of the gas can all total and (2) of which I keep in my blazer at all times so when I find a good deal on gad I fill my truck and these 2 gas cans and bring them home and and fill my trucks, tractors, other gas cans, etc. then I put these 2 empty gas can back in my blazer. These seal so good I never smell gas reeking in the cab what so ever. ********I love this product******** Buy with comfidence RagenRat

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, and very high quality metal gas can
customer_reviews.text: Great idea , and very high quality metal gas can . Funnel is a huge plus .
customer_reviews.author: Robby E Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tired of PLASTIC breaking.
customer_reviews.text: All these no spill safety gas cans keep breaking spouts and cracking on me and spill gas all the time! NOT with this Eagle can, this will put the fuel where it should go with control! The can is metal and will not crack in the sun or leak. The 2 gallon is great for chain saws and weed eaters. Try one and you won't go back!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. F. Matson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this for the snow blower. He says it is the perfect size for small amounts of gasoline. And it doesn't spill a drop. He regrets not buying it sooner!

customer_reviews.title: BulletProof!- Worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing 2 plastic gas cans in two years, I finally bought a true quality item. Expensive yes, but this can will be around for my son to inherit. The same goes for the 1 gallon can.
customer_reviews.author: M. Winter

customer_reviews.title: quality tank
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of the plastic gas cans and purchased this one. I really like the quality of this can, but it is expensive. I sure hope it doesn't get stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jinks

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: I was originally looking for a one gallon can. I use this can for my oil mixed gas. This can should last the rest of my life and maybe my kids as well. This can is extremely well built. I would recommend this can to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MN Big B

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty gas can
customer_reviews.text: Very well built unit. Shipped in winter, so it took a little warming to open due to vacuum lock. Just wish it came in 2-1/2 gallon
customer_reviews.author: Robb Chipgus

product_meta.title: Eagle UI-20-FS Red Galvanized Steel Type 1 Gasoline Safety Can with Funnel, 2 gallon Capacity, 9.5" Height, 11.25" Diameter
product_meta.description:
Size:2 gallon

The Eagle Type I galvanized steel safety can with funnel is used to store, transport, and dispense flammable liquids safely and comes with a funnel to facilitate filling and pouring. The can is made of 24-gauge galvanized steel, which is resistant to rust, dents, and certain chemicals. Gauge is a measure of thickness (the lower the gauge, the thicker the material). The powder-coated finish resists scratches, chipping, fading, and other wear. A flame arrestor helps prevent liquids inside the can from igniting and keep flames from spreading. The spout cap self-closes to help prevent leaks or spills. The cap assembly opens automatically to vent internal vapors. A trilingual safety warning label alerts users to the can's contents. The funnel is made of HDPE (high-density polyethylene), which is resistant to dents, punctures, and certain chemicals. This safety can may be available in different colors (blue for kerosene, green for oil or other combustibles, red for gasoline, or yellow for diesel) to separate, store, and identify different liquids. This product is FM Approved as a safety can used for handling flammable liquids in quantities of 5 gallons or less. It complies with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Standard 1910.106 for the safe storage and handling of flammable liquids. It meets National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) Code 30, which provides safeguards to reduce the hazards associated with the storage, handling, and use of flammable and combustible liquids. It is Underwriters Laboratories (UL) Listed and meets UL safety requirements.

Hazardous storage cans are used to safely store, transport, and dispense flammable or hazardous liquids. They are typically made of polyethylene, 24-gauge galvanized steel, or 24-gauge stainless steel. (Gauge is a measure of thickness; the lower the gauge, the thicker the material.) Hazardous storage cans come in a variety of styles, such as Type I cans, which have a single spout for filling and pouring, and Type II cans, which have a flexible metal hose for pouring and a second opening for filling. They are often color-coded for different liquids (for instance, red cans for gasoline, blue cans for kerosene, yellow cans for diesel fuel, or green cans for oil). Other common features include flame arrestors, which help prevent the liquid inside the can from igniting, and seam welds, which help prevent leaks. Certain hazardous storage cans are FM Approved, and many meet National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) and Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standards for the storage and handling of flammable liquids. Hazardous storage cans are used in a variety of commercial and industrial environments and can also be suitable for home use.

Eagle Manufacturing Company manufactures industrial safety, haz-mat, and storage products that meet International Organization for Standardization (ISO) standards for quality assurance. The company, founded in 1894, is headquartered in Wellsburg, VA.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Eagle 2 Gallon Red Safety Gasoline Can meets OSHA and NFPA Code 30 requirements and are UL and ULC listed and are FM Factory Mutual approved for the safe handling and storage of gasoline and other flammable liquids. Eagle cans feature Lead Free Technology, constructed of 24-gauge hot dipped Galvanized steel, deep drawn one piece seamless body construction, non sparking brass integral pour spout, with a spring closing lid with neoprene gasket which vents at 3-5 psi internal pressure. The can features a fixed handle and patented comfort grip trigger release for easy dispensing, a double interlock no-weld bottom seam, 100% Leak tested, and a baked on red powder coat finish. Eagle cans are made in the USA, by USA workers and with USA quality. Family owned business making quality products since 1894 in Wellsburg, West Virginia
feature_bullets: Type I safety can used to store, transport, and dispense flammable liquids safely; comes with a funnel to facilitate filling and pouring
Made of galvanized steel, which is resistant to rust, dents, and certain chemicals; powder-coated finish resists scratches, chipping, fading, and other wear
Flame arrestor helps prevent liquids inside the can from igniting and keep flames from spreading
Spout cap self-closes to help prevent leaks or spills; cap assembly opens automatically to vent internal vapors
FM Approved; complies with OSHA Standard 1910.106 for the safe storage and handling of flammable liquids
2 gallon gasoline Safety can with poly yellow funnel
100% leak tested, UL and ULC listed and FM Approved
Patented comfort grip Trigger release with spring closing lid and fixed Handle
Red baked on powder coat finish over lead free galvanized steel construction
